There is a huge amount of info on this message board though.. It took 
me a week to read through almost everything and a lot of stuff is 
really interesting. I havent been posting much since I am waiting for 
the sourceforge boys to do more characters, spells and maybe 
something like LAN play. I keep up though. Just my thoughts.


--- In gladiator@y..., "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@u...> 
wrote:
> > If you want, a mailing list could be set up at sourceforge. It'd 
> also benefit from people just finding out about Gladiator and 
joining 
> it (I do have a link to this group from the front page, but not 
many 
> people go to the front page). An tracker item can also be added 
where 
> people would be able to upload maps and stuff, so the files section 
> won't be lost.
> 
> One possible solution was setting up a message board to run off the 
> fsgames.com website.  As long the number of messages doesn't get 
out 
> of hand, that'll be cheap enough. (The only way the number of 
messages 
> would get out of hand is if a new version came out, but then 
revenue 
> would be coming in to pay for it.)
> 
> > Also on the short term, reluctantly I am considering shutting 
down  
> public access to message archives to keep spammers from harvesting 
> email addresses from our messages.
> 
> I would like to hear some more opinions before shutting off message 
> archives.
